Uses of Interface
net.xqhs.flash.core.support.MessagingShard

  • Packages that use MessagingShard 
    Package Description
    example.simplePingPong
    The scenario of two agents which ping messages between them (one sends and one replies).
    net.xqhs.flash.core.monitoring  
    net.xqhs.flash.core.node
    The package contains classes needed for easily deploying Flash agents.
    net.xqhs.flash.core.shard
    The package contains interfaces and abstract classes for core agent features.
    net.xqhs.flash.core.support
    Core classes dealing with support items, such as communication and mobility.
    net.xqhs.flash.local
    Package that offers support for local communication.
    net.xqhs.flash.webSocket

    • Uses of MessagingShard in net.xqhs.flash.core.support

      Classes in net.xqhs.flash.core.support that implement MessagingShard 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      class  AbstractMessagingShard
      Prototype class for shards offering messaging functionality, containing some general implementation-independent methods.
      class  AbstractNameBasedMessagingShard
      A simple extension of AbstractMessagingShard, which leaves to implement only AbstractMessagingShard.sendMessage(String, String, String) as an abstract method, and also the registration of a message receiver to the pylon.

    • Uses of MessagingShard in net.xqhs.flash.local

      Classes in net.xqhs.flash.local that implement MessagingShard 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  LocalPylon.SimpleLocalMessaging
      Simple implementation of AbstractMessagingShard, that uses agents' names as their addresses.

    • Uses of MessagingShard in net.xqhs.flash.webSocket

      Classes in net.xqhs.flash.webSocket that implement MessagingShard 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      class  WebSocketMessagingShard
      The WebSocketMessagingShard class manages the link between agent's messaging service and its pylon.
